content: dream valley blanket crochet pattern by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful https //www ravelry com/designers/susan-e-kennedy @prettypeacefulcrochet on instagram pretty peaceful on facebook pretty peaceful youtube video tutorials sizes 42 by 52 inches 107 by 132 cm using 3 skeins or 42 by 69 inches 107 by 175 cm using 4 skeins yarn worsted weight medium category 4 3 or 4 skeins of red heart granny square all in one yarn that is 1 251 yards 1 143 meters of yarn for a 3-skein blanket or 1 668 yards 1 525 meters for a 4-skein blanket the sample blanket used 3 skeins of red heart granny square all in one yarn in the soft white - frigid colorway 100% acrylic 417 yards 381 m per 250-gram skein add the next skein whenever the previous skein runs out and don t worry if it starts on a different color go with the flow of color changes- no cutting or controlling of colors needed introduction video https //youtu be/9lccbjs5jy8 si=lnaoz1dav6r7oypo yarn worsted weight red heart granny square all in one recommended hook size 6 5 mm us k gauge 10 double_crochet stitches = 4 inches 10 cm 5 5 row = 4 inches 10 cm terms us double_crochet double_crochet yarn over insert hook into stitch yarn over pull through stitch yarn over pull through two loops yarn over pull through both loops on hook foundation double_crochet optional a method for beginning a row without having to make a separate row of chains first see http //www mooglyblog com/foundation-double-crochet-fdc/ for a video tutorial csdc optional chainless starting double_crochet a method for beginning each row without having to chain this method helps to keep your edges straight see http //www mooglyblog com/chainless-starting-double-crochet/ for a video tutorial dream valley blanket crochet pattern © 2023 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful dream valley blanket row 1 chain 110 double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook counts as 1st stitch and all chains across 108 double_crochet or foundation double_crochet 108 stitches see video link above for how to foundation double_crochet this option gives a neat edge to the blanket row 2 and all other row chain 3 or csdc counts as 1st stitch double_crochet in next stitch and all stitches across 108 double_crochet you will crochet about 74 row total for a 3-skein blanket or about 99 row for a 4-skein blanket to add a new skein or work around a knot i like to use the russian join method video tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=9mxt2mrr894 having trouble check out tamara kelly s video tutorials on her excellent crochet blog moogly she shows how to hold the yarn and hook how to make a slipknot how to make a chain and how to double_crochet http //www mooglyblog com/learn-how-to-crochet/ left-handed video http //www mooglyblog
